text: When I notice team members needing direction, I recognize it and choose to provide clear vision and guidance instead.
During moments when leadership is needed, I notice it and choose to step up and guide with clarity instead.
When I feel the pull to focus only on immediate tasks, I notice it and choose to consider long-term vision instead.
I let not being able to inspire others prevent me from providing clear vision and strategic direction.
When I notice team dynamics shifting, I recognize it and choose to guide and influence positively instead.
I see when strategic planning is needed, and I choose to think ahead and develop long-term plans instead.
When I feel the urge to react without thinking, I notice it and choose to stay calm and lead strategically instead.
I let not identifying leadership opportunities prevent me from inspiring others and providing direction effectively.
When I notice myself leading well, I recognize it and choose to maintain those strategic and inspiring patterns.
I recognize when situations need leadership, and I choose to step up and guide with vision instead.
When I feel the pull to avoid responsibility, I notice it and choose to take ownership and lead instead.
I let problems from not leading prevent me from maintaining strategic direction and inspiring others.
When I notice strategic leadership working, I recognize it and choose to strengthen those patterns.
I see when teams need mentoring, and I choose to invest time in developing others instead.
When I feel the urge to let emotions control my leadership, I notice it and choose to stay calm and strategic instead.
I let not being able to lead prevent me from maintaining strategic direction and inspiring others effectively.
When I notice myself maintaining leadership presence, I recognize it and choose to strengthen those patterns.
I recognize when vision is needed, and I choose to communicate big-picture goals and inspire others instead.
When I feel the pull to focus only on results, I notice it and choose to develop people and build culture instead.
I let not identifying leadership abilities prevent me from inspiring others and providing strategic direction effectively.
